title: Valley Mission launches fundraising campaign to finish roof so people in need will have shelter this winter | APG State News | idahopress.com
text:
POCATELLO â€” Valley Mission is asking the community for assistance in its fundraising campaign to finish its roof during this time of frigid temperatures and falling snow.
According to a news release from Valley Mission, the fundraising goal for the project is $40,000. Thanks to a matching gift, every donation will be matched dollar-for-dollar up to $5,000 per donation.
Karl Pettit, acting director of Valley Mission, located at 442 N. Arthur Ave. in downtown Pocatello, said in the news release that it is important the roof be completed as soon as possible so Valley Mission will be able to be a shelter for people during the winter months.
"This is not just a building," Pettit said in the news release. "It's a beacon of hope for people... who survive in their vehicles, on the streets or in tents during these cold months."
The fundraising campaign to finish the roof is part of the Avenues for Hope Housing Challenge, which will run until the end of this month. Valley Mission hopes to raise $200,000 during the challenge to fund several projects such as its emergency overnight shelter, food pantry and medical clinic.
Valley Mission has currently raised $18,130 out of its $200,000 goal. They are hopeful that the community will come together to help them raise more.

There are currently around 100 people in Pocatello who sleep on the streets every night. Valley Mission's Street Reach Team works to bring these people food, clothing and hygiene items. They help people meet their immediate needs and they connect them with resources for housing, medical supplies and others services.
Anyone who wants to help Valley Mission with their efforts can either donate, spread the word or volunteer with the organization.
Pettit said in the news release that Valley Mission hopes to create a safe place where lives can be transformed.
"Together we can give our neighbors the gift of hope and a brighter future this holiday season," Petit said in the news release.
Donations can be made at valleymission.org .
